title: European Commission - DigComp 2.2: Digital Competence Framework for Citizens
description: The EU-wide framework defining digital competence across 5 areas and 21 competences, helping policymakers design education and training initiatives.

title: European Commission - Digital Skills Initiatives
description: Overview of EU programmes supporting digital skills development, including funding opportunities and policy frameworks for member states.

title: World Bank - Data Use and Literacy Program Resources
description: Collection of MOOCs and training materials for data producers, users, and policymakers, with courses available in multiple languages.

title: OECD - Bridging the AI Skills Gap
description: Analysis of government policies and training initiatives for developing both advanced AI expertise and general AI literacy.

title: UNESCO - Digital Competency Framework for Civil Servants
description: Context-sensitive framework with guidelines, resources and tools for governments to develop AI and digital transformation competencies.

title: UNESCO & Oxford - AI and Digital Transformation in Government (Free MOOC)
description: Free online course launched in 2025 for civil servants, featuring case studies from the Global South and available in multiple languages.

title: UK Government - Digital, Data and Technology (DDaT) Capability Framework
description: Comprehensive framework defining over 160 skills across 43 digital roles, creating standardised career paths across UK government.

title: Canada - GC Digital Competencies for All Public Servants
description: Six foundational digital competencies for all Canadian public servants, including digital literacy, data stewardship, and cyber security vigilance.

title: Data to Policy Navigator - Build Data Capacities
description: Practical guide on systematically building data capacities through training, partnerships, and institutionalisation strategies.

title: World Bank - Skills Development Overview
description: Overview of World Bank support for skills development systems, including case studies and measurement tools like STEP and SABER-WfD.

title: OECD - Developing Skills for Digital Government
description: Comprehensive report examining skills development approaches across multiple OECD countries including Germany, France, Denmark, and Australia.
